title: France's best art exhibitions this fall, in Paris and beyond

Trump to host G20 at his 'beautiful' Miami golf resort: 'Each country will have its own building'
subhead: Billionaire Trump said his Trump National Doral resort and spa was the ideal choice for the gathering in December next year because it is 'beautiful' and the Florida weather is nice. 'I think it will be really a beautiful thing,' he told reporters on Friday.

title: In Genoa, a mission for Gaza revives the city's activist past
subhead: Dockworkers from the port of the Ligurian capital – known for the major protests against the G8 summit in 2001 – are at the forefront of the 'Global Sumud Flotilla,' a grassroots initiative hoping to break the blockade on the Palestinian enclave and deliver humanitarian aid.

title: Glenn Martens, fashion at high-voltage
subhead: 'Essence of a Style' (4/6). Appointed to the helm of some of the biggest fashion houses, six designers are set to command the industry's attention this season. We look back at what has defined their distinctive touch so far, before their trial by fire. In this chapter, the former artistic director of the label Y/Project, now at Maison Margiela while continuing his work for Diesel.

title: The meteoric rise and exploited fame of Jean Pormanove, French streamer who died on-air
subhead: Jean Pormanove, a 46-year-old streamer, died on August 18 while streaming live on the Kick platform. He launched his career by streaming the video game 'Fortnite,' but ultimately became the star of a humiliating spectacle.

'Dear Salman Rushdie…': Isabelle Adjani's stand against religious fundamentalism
subhead: 'Adjani, The Famous Stranger' (4/6). After Iran issued a fatwa against the British writer in 1989, the French actress used the César Awards ceremony to show her support for the author of 'The Satanic Verses.' She was one of the few in the film industry to take such a stand.

title: 'Block Everything': Anger in France is deep, but mass strikes appear unlikely
subhead: The choice of a Wednesday for the planned September 10 protests raises questions about who has the option to strike, especially as labor disputes in French workplaces have been particularly rare in recent years.

title: Paris, the capital of concentrated wealth
subhead: The accumulation of riches in the French capital 'has reached unprecedented proportions,' according to a report on this new social geography shaped by decades of growing wealth inequality by the Fondation Jean-Jaurès.
